reviewText: This game is a peice of crap, yes the levels and visuals are good but when it comes to shooting games its the AI and story that make the game and this game did a terrible job. Such things as: Enemies running to your grenades or standing there like nothing is wrong, Allies shooting at the ground or other objects and not focusing on the enemy, ammo for guns is different even if you have the same gun but a different etacthmernt, some parts of the game do not offer a checkpoint when needed, enemies have too high of an aim system meaning a one hit kill from out of nowhere. After about the 4th level I uninstalled it which I never do for any games (except for the binding of isaac)\n\nif you are okay with above then by all means by it but if my review hit home then stay away from this sorry excuse for an FPS

reviewText:
Can't decide what to play?  Just start playing Homefront while you think about it.  By the time you decide, the game will be over.  I beat it in 5 hours but I also took some time to look for some of the extras, so yeah, it's that short.
This doesn't necessarily mean it's all bad.  It's got a fairly memorable campaign with quick fighting and some challenging moments.  The graphics are great, the shooting is tight.
As for the story, I'm a little torn.  On one hand, the concept of an occupied America makes the environment engrossing, so the story pulls you in more than, say, most Call of Duty games.  On the other hand the action in some areas is too ridiculous to be taken seriously, counteracting the attempt at an emotional campaign.  And considering you play a freedom fighter with supposed limited resources, guns are f***ing everywhere!  I don't think I ever had less than half ammo in any gun before I was able to grab another and everywhere I stepped I was picking up more grenades.  With all the sh** the Koreans leave lying around, how is it the Americans haven't wiped them out ages ago?
Anyways, I got it for like a 1.25, so I can't complain.  Fun, short little romp.  Recommended?  Meh.  Sure as hell not for 20.00.

reviewText: I can really not recommend this game. The campaign is easy, boring and you will find more controversial scenes in every Call of Duty game if you are looking for something like that. The story has some decent approaches but fails in realizing them. Also it can be beaten in 3-4 hours and the multiplayer is pretty much dead. It had major flaws in the beginning and now that it's okay nobody plays it any more.\n\nIn fact, you want to purchase either Call of Duty for fast-paced run-and-gun gameplay or Battlefield for Vehicle Warfare. The combination of these two playstyles just doesn't work and nobody plays Homefront anyway.

reviewText:
It is the year 2027. You are Robert Jacobs. The so called Greater Korean Republic has taken over the western part of America. Robert Jacobs is a former Marine helicopter pilot. Somehow, a link must be made between saving the world and being a pilot, but no. You use a car which you actually control remotely, like a little boy. Your mission is to bring fuel to a military base in San Francisco, and because of this America gets saved. The irony of this is that only hippies live there who drive electric cars that they are put up with by environmentalism people. You have to do this with a team, consisting of a black person, a woman, a feeble-minded rambo and a technician who is a half Korean, meaning your team is composed of nothing but imbeciles.

Note: The only Black Person in the game dies before the halfway point.

The single player starts off as a pilot in the year 2027. You are sitting in your room staring at a wall for some strange reason when suddenly a few commies knock on your door. They take you outside after they punched you in the face and throw you in what was used to be a school bus.
At this moment the player ought to see all the lulzy things that happen outside, children getting ♥♥♥♥♥, people dying, Korean variants of Razzia's and all other sorts of fun things, which makes them Nazi copyists. Unfortunately, your execution will be postponed because some members of the Resistance Movement blow up your bus to save you, which is dumb as ♥♥♥♥ because they could've killed you too, making them a bunch of sadistic ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.
Take a ride in this beautiful bus so you can end your miserable life.
This is the point where the game gets gradually worse, because they actually manage to save you. You don't want this. You want do die, your life sucks. But they force you to join their Resistance, which makes hem even bigger sadistic ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.


The game won't last much longer from now on, considering that the single player will take you about five hours. From this point on, you will not notice difference between most levels as every level is the same apathic, miserable and dying mess like in the bus at the beginning. In every level you will kill Koreans, blow stuff up, kill Koreans, use some kind of vehicle that blows stuff up, kill Koreans, save your ♥♥♥ and finally kill Koreans. Strikingly enough, you will actually fly a helicopter once. ORLY, you're a pilot!

reviewText: Ahh. so we have come to homefront well first i would like to talk about multiplayer. it is not all that great, i mean i love it but it doesent let u get asmany upgrades and somegames (mw1,2,3) and the graphics arnt as good. but now off of that this game is all abut the story line. In a word BREATHAKING. The suspence fills the air with a thickness u could cut with a knife. Just the way they played the storyline out if i mght channal my inner gamer AWSOME".  Just the whole idea of the Korea's army uniting and taking over America is gripping. it is a very in your face game. Literatly u neer stop moving. you also have the power to take to the skyes in a range of helecopters.\nover all it is a truly great game totaly worth buying. *Be warned it is filled with multiplayer hackers though i believe that the "Dev's" patched most of that there is still a few raindrops tthat slip through* But dont get ur hopes up its lie that with eery game but eventaly it stops. i have experianced fewer hackers"
